text: - So I always say that when joining AWS,

there are a lot of things
that you need to learn

but there is also a lot of
things that you need to unlearn.
My name is Yasmine Afifi.
I am the Corporate Counsel
supporting public sector business.

I work with the customer's
legal department
to explain to them what cloud is,
how here it is.
I started my career
in a very different industry.
I developed the passion for technology

and really was so interested
in the intersection
between the law and technology.

It doesn't come naturally
for lawyers to take risks
or to be able to move fast,
to adapt to the speed of business.
One of the skills that I've learned a lot
and I keep learning in Amazon
is how can we have bias for action,

move with speed while taking
calculated smart risks.
I enjoy working for AWS.
I work hard

but I also can enjoy
flexibility to disconnect,
spend quality time with my family.
And so I find
AWS to have
that culture of understanding,
the need for flexibility.

It's amazing how it's been two
and a half years in the job
and I'm still learning
and there's a lot to learn.
(lively music)
